import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    remaining_capacity = bins - item
    max_capacity = np.max(bins)
    remaining_capacity_ratio = remaining_capacity / max_capacity
    scores = (remaining_capacity_ratio * (1 / np.sqrt(np.arange(len(bins)) + 1))) / np.sqrt(remaining_capacity * np.log(remaining_capacity))
    scores -= (remaining_capacity_ratio - np.sqrt(np.arange(len(bins)) + 1))
    scores = np.where(remaining_capacity >= item, np.inf, scores)
    scores *= np.arange(len(bins)) + 1
    scores -= np.where(remaining_capacity < item, np.log(item), 0)
    threshold_ratio = 0.5
    scores -= np.where(remaining_capacity_ratio < threshold_ratio, np.log(1 + threshold_ratio - remaining_capacity_ratio), 0) 
    # New step: Multiply scores by a logarithmic factor of the bin index plus one, divided by the square root of the item size
    scores *= np.log(np.arange(len(bins)) + 1) / np.sqrt(item)
    return scores
